reviews.review_msg: Draining+exhausting class. Unclear grading criteria, unhelpful prof, extremely rude feedback on assignments, be prepared to be spending 10+ hours PER week on this class. You won't understand what's expected of you - he'll tell you to figure it out on your own. This class DOES prepare you to be a consultant ... at the cost of your mental health.

Please quit. This course is useless. You will learn nothing, I mean NOTHING, from this guy. It is a total waste of tuition. The course is useless, the text is useless, his materials are useless..... this list will go endless. Dont take any class with him!

Ron is still the best professor I've encountered after 4 years of taking courses at SFU. He takes the time to ensure everyone is on the same page, and if not, he guides you through your stuck points. He wants you to get a good mark! Would 100% recommend any student to take on a course he teaches.

Ron was one of my best teachers in Langara. He inspired me to improve. His methodology consists of learning and then explaining to others. About technical things that I learned, I can say how to get to the root of the problems and then work from there to have changed. You can apply that to everything you want.

While Ron is relatively a nice guy, he's anal about the smallest things and you won't learn much in class. He gets upset and calls you out if your camera is too dark or you have your computer on your lap. Most classes were just discussions about our feelings and reflections. There's a video assignment every week that are useless.
